result.execSummary:
The defendant Donnevan T Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Provide DNA Sample.
No unsupervised contact with child, unless modified by court or agent.

Parenting classes, Can use Fatherhood Program.
Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donnevan T Carter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donnevan T Carter not in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
The defendant is in absconder status.  The Court lifted the stay on the condition time 60 DAYS) and ordered a commitment to issue.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.

Defendant Donnevan T Carter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Donnevan T Carter in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statements by defendant's mother.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 68 DAYS time served, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Parenting classes, Can use Fatherhood Program.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-Complete 25 HOURS of community service.
-No unsupervised contact with child, unless modified by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA  surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donnevan T Carter in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE, this incident occurred after 4/1/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Donnevan T Carter not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Plea & Sentencing to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 01, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: DTC -DOB: 4/2/2011, unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved and monitored by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Donnevan T Carter in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Donnevan T Carter in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
On motion of the State, Court Amends Complaint.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
